H0.text: Selective breeding is the application for which gel electrophoresis technology, which allows researchers to reliably separate and sort DNA fragments, is most useful.

H1.text: Medical gene repair is the most useful application for gel electrophoresis, a technology that allows researchers to reliably separate and sort DNA fragments.

H2.text: Genetic engineering is the application for which gel electrophoresis, a technology that allows researchers to reliably separate and sort DNA fragments, is most useful.

H3.text: Cell metabolism analysis is the most useful application for gel electrophoresis, a technology that allows researchers to reliably separate and sort DNA fragments.

A4.text: The gene is separated by using restriction enzymes to cut the DNA into fragments or polymerase chain reaction (PCR) to amplify up the gene segment. These segments can then be extracted through gel electrophoresis.
